project_abstract.cdata: The broader policy objective of the Programmatic Bank and Corporate Restructuring Program Adjustment Loan/Credit is to support the Government's Bank and Corporate Restructuring Program (BCRP), aimed at strengthening the financial and corporate sectors, lowering systemic risks, and reducing the probability o f crises. This will provide an enabling environment to restart prudent lending, ultimately boosting economic growth. The Bank/Association's (hereinafter called the Bank) strategy for Bolivia's financial and corporate sectors calls for operations in a programmatic context, each focusing on distinct policy measures and actions that, taken as a whole, would contribute to the strengthening of the financial and corporate sectors and support the Government's BCRP. The Government's program, supported by this operation, involves seven main components: (a) organizational arrangements to manage systemic bank and corporate restructuring, (b) legal clarity on appropriate distribution of  regulatory powers, (c) bank and corporate diagnosis; (d) prudential strengthening and prompt corrective action for banks; (d) bank resolution framework; (e) legal and institutional framework for corporate restructuring; and (f) anti-money laundering. Such comprehensive and cohesive program is essential to realign incentives and set in motion a process where: (i) viable banks participate in the restructuring of troubled but viable corporations that make the needed efforts to restore their financial health, (ii) troubled but viable banks restructure and regain medium-term profitability, and (iii) unviable banks and corporations exit the system in an orderly manner. While the first Loan/Credit would have conditionality largely based on actions in the banking sector, the second loan would follow a similar design, but with flexibility to include conditionality on the corporate sector if sufficient
